newsitem.title: UK: BPB shares up on technical rebound, visit.
newsitem.headline: BPB shares up on technical rebound, visit.

text.p: Shares in UK plasterboard manufacturer BPB Plc strengthened in a weak market on Friday, helped by a technical rebound and re-evaluation of the company's outlook after an analysts' visit to a new factory in Germany.
BPB shares were up 6-1/2p at 373-1/2p at 1105 GMT while the FTSE 100 index was weak amid investor worries about U.S. jobs figures to be released at 1230 GMT.
"The stock was oversold yesterday and analysts came back from the new factory quite positive," one marketmaker said.
"We're pretty positive on the stock and are retaining it on market outperformer," Mike Betts, building analyst at Goldman Sachs in London said.

"The most important thing from the visit was confirmation that the feared weakening in German plasterboard prices does not yet seem to have happened despite the increase in plasterboard capacity in the last months," Betts said.
Betts said the new German plant in Berlin should bring cost savings and boost German profit margins as well as adding capacity in eastern Europe which should reduce cross-Europe transport costs.
"We're looking to meet a shortfall in capacity in eastern Germany with the new plant," BPB finance director Peter Sydney-Smith said in a phone interview.
"Demand in Germany has increased dramatically and also in eastern Europe but transporting the product there is expensive...we're hoping to save significantly on transport costs," Sydney-Smith said.
